forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 62. West southwest wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers before 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 65 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 5 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As daylight unfurls over Downtown San Francisco, the skies remain cloaked in a soft shroud of clouds, hinting at an interlude of rain that lingers in the air. The temperature, resting gently around the low sixties, suggests a mild embrace, though the atmosphere carries the possibility of a few scattered showers throughout the day. The west-southwest winds whisper a tale of gentle breezes, adding to the soft murmur of the day. With glimpses of sun asserting themselves intermittently, there is a canvas of evolving weather to behold, where sunny blue spaces encourage the hope of brightness, even as clouds drift lazily by.

The marine layer persists, especially along the coastline, where fog may secretly embrace the golden towers of the bridge, inviting onlookers to ponder the mysteries hidden by mist. Dressing with layers would be wise; a light jacket alongside breathable attire can offer comfort against the coolness that can creep in as the day progresses. A stroll through neighborhood streets might yield delights of the unexpected; a visit to a tucked-away café for a warm cup or a moment spent in one of the many quaint parks could provide respite against the uncertainty of precipitation. A good book in hand while sitting beneath a tree, sheltering from any unexpected drops, seems a fitting way to savor the evolving day.
